oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: WSM Variety Award Presentation - 1954-01-21 (copy) - Part 3
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: WSM program aimed at George Rosen of Variety magazine. Written by Bill Graham; engineered by Elmer Alley, Charles Bragg, Glen Snoddy, and Tom Sparkman; produced by Noel Digby. Part three of six. This disc is a duplicate of TR001249_1.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Hank Williams; Lawrence Goodman; Betty Brown; Richard Rivers; Fisk University Choir; Roy Petty; Beasley Smith; Owen Bradley Quintet; Hilltoppers; Del Wood; Jordanaires; Dottie Dillard; Marvin Hughes; Don Estes; John Gordy; Bob Lamb; Bob Johnstone
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Cold, Cold Heart (excerpt) (Hank Williams) -- David Cobb talks about Hank Williams -- Ernie Keller and David Cobb talk about Opry performances for charity and the military -- Ernie Keller and David Cobb report on an Opry survey -- David Cobb and Ernie Keller talk about 'non-hillbilly' talent -- Ernie Keller introduces Lawrence Goodman -- Fantasiestücke, Op. 12, 2. Aufschwung (excerpt) (Lawrence Goodman) -- David Cobb introduces Sidney Dalton and the program Exploring Music -- Exploring Music (excerpt) -- David Cobb introduces Betty Brown and Richard Rivers -- Song Of Love (excerpt) (Betty Brown, Richard Rivers) -- Ernie Keller introduces various vocalists -- In The River Of Jordan (excerpt) (Fisk University Choir) -- Ernie Keller talks about the Fisk University Choir -- Ernie Keller introduces Roy Petty -- On The Road To Mandalay (excerpt) (Roy Petty) -- Ernie Keller talks about popular music -- [Unidentified musical excerpt] (Beasley Smith) -- Ernie Keller talks about Beasley Smith and the program Eight O'Clock Time -- David Cobb talks about the WSM Orchestra -- Ernie Keller introduces WSM conductors Francis Craig and Owen Bradley -- [Unidentified musical excerpt] (Owen Bradley Quintet) -- David Cobb talks about Beasley Smith -- Ernie Keller talks about Owen Bradley -- Ernie Keller and David Cobb talk about artists to record with Owen Bradley and the WSM Orchestra -- Trying (excerpt) (The Hilltoppers) -- David Cobb talks about The Hilltoppers -- David Cobb introduces Del Wood -- Down Yonder (excerpt) (Del Wood) -- Ernie Keller introduces various groups -- Dig A Little Deeper (excerpt) (The Jordanaires) -- Ernie Keller introduces Dottie Dillard -- I've Got A Right To Cry (excerpt) (Dottie Dillard) -- Ernie Keller introduces Marvin 'Friday' Hughes -- Beale Street Blues (excerpt) (Marvin Hughes) -- David Cobb introduces Don Estes -- All Day Singin' And Dinner On The Ground (excerpt) (Don Estes) -- Ernie Keller introduces John Gordy -- Panama (excerpt) (John Gordy) -- David Cobb introduces Bob Lamb -- I Still Get A Thrill (excerpt) (Bob Lamb) -- Ernie Keller introduces Bob Johnstone -- Alone Together (excerpt) (Bob Johnstone)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); Cobb, David (Announcer); Keller, Ernie; Williams, Hank, 1923-1953; Goodman, Lawrence (Pianist); Bradley, Owen; Owen Bradley Quintet; Craig, Francis, 1900-1966; Wood, Del; WSM Orchestra; Jordanaires (Musical group); Hilltoppers (Musical group); Dillard, Dottie; Exploring music (Radio program); Fisk University. Choir; Smith, Beasley; Eight o'clock time (Radio program); Hughes, Marvin; Estes, Don (Vocalist); Gordy, John (Pianist);
